ApiStage.description: API stage name of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

properties.name: ApiId
properties.description: API Id of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

type.description: API Id of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

properties.name: Stage
properties.description: API stage name of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

type.description: API stage name of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

properties.name: Throttle
properties.description: Map containing method level throttling information for API stage in a usage plan.

type.description: Map containing method level throttling information for API stage in a usage plan.

QuotaSettings.description:
``QuotaSettings`` is a property of the [AWS::ApiGateway::UsagePlan](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-apigateway-usageplan.html) resource that specifies a target for the maximum number of requests users can make to your REST APIs.
 In some cases clients can exceed the targets that you set. Don’t rely on usage plans to control costs. Consider using [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html) to monitor costs and [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/waf-chapter.html) to manage API requests.

properties.name: Limit
properties.description: The target maximum number of requests that can be made in a given time period.

type.description: The target maximum number of requests that can be made in a given time period.

properties.name: Offset
properties.description: The number of requests subtracted from the given limit in the initial time period.

type.description: The number of requests subtracted from the given limit in the initial time period.

properties.name: Period
properties.description: The time period in which the limit applies. Valid values are "DAY", "WEEK" or "MONTH".

type.description: The time period in which the limit applies. Valid values are "DAY", "WEEK" or "MONTH".

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

ThrottleSettings.description: ``ThrottleSettings`` is a property of the [AWS::ApiGateway::UsagePlan](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-apigateway-usageplan.html) resource that specifies the overall request rate (average requests per second) and burst capacity when users call your REST APIs.

properties.name: BurstLimit
properties.description: The API target request burst rate limit. This allows more requests through for a period of time than the target rate limit.

type.description: The API target request burst rate limit. This allows more requests through for a period of time than the target rate limit.

properties.name: RateLimit
properties.description: The API target request rate limit.

type.description: The API target request rate limit.

resource.description:
The ``AWS::ApiGateway::UsagePlan`` resource creates a usage plan for deployed APIs. A usage plan sets a target for the throttling and quota limits on individual client API keys. For more information, see [Creating and Using API Usage Plans in Amazon API Gateway](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-api-usage-plans.html) in the *API Gateway Developer Guide*.
 In some cases clients can exceed the targets that you set. Don’t rely on usage plans to control costs. Consider using [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html) to monitor costs and [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/waf-chapter.html) to manage API requests.

properties.name: ApiStages
properties.description: The associated API stages of a usage plan.

type.description: The associated API stages of a usage plan.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: The description of a usage plan.

type.description: The description of a usage plan.

properties.name: Quota
properties.description: The target maximum number of permitted requests per a given unit time interval.

type.description: The target maximum number of permitted requests per a given unit time interval.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The collection of tags. Each tag element is associated with a given resource.

type.description: The collection of tags. Each tag element is associated with a given resource.

properties.name: Throttle
properties.description: A map containing method level throttling information for API stage in a usage plan.

type.description: A map containing method level throttling information for API stage in a usage plan.

properties.name: UsagePlanName
properties.description: The name of a usage plan.

type.description: The name of a usage plan.

attributes.description:

For more information, see [Creating and Using API Usage Plans in Amazon API Gateway](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-api-usage-plans.html) in the *API Gateway Developer Guide*.
 In some cases clients can exceed the targets that you set. Don’t rely on usage plans to control costs. Consider using [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html) to monitor costs and [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/developerguide/waf-chapter.html) to manage API requests.
